entry.title: New Research Suggests Hal Finney Was Not Satoshi Nakamoto
entry.summary:
In an extensive analysis, the American software engineer and columnist Jameson Lopp tackles the enduring mystery of Bitcoin‚Äôs creator, Satoshi Nakamoto. While many have speculated that computer scientist Hal Finney was behind the pseudonym, Lopp presents several compelling instances that counter this theory. Here‚Äôs what Lopp‚Äôs research unveiled.
The Satoshi Mystery: Jameson Lopp‚Äôs Research Debunks Hal Finney Theories
The identity of Satoshi Nakamoto, since Bitcoin‚Äôs genesis in 2009, has remained one of the biggest mysteries. While Nakamoto‚Äôs true identity doesn‚Äôt alter Bitcoin‚Äôs trajectory, the speculation has had tangible repercussions for individuals like Hal Finney.
In his report, Jameson Lopp describes how speculation had affected Finney‚Äôs life and Dorian Nakamoto as well when th‚Ä¶

Bitcoin‚Äôs Daily Transactions See Sharp 46% Decline Since Mid-September
entry.summary:
Over the past 37 days, since September 15, 2023, the number of daily bitcoin transactions has dropped considerably, with the trend of Ordinal inscriptions experiencing a significant slowdown. In the first two weeks of September, the average number of daily transactions confirmed on the Bitcoin blockchain decreased by more than 46%.
2023‚Äôs Bitcoin Transaction Paradox: A Year of Growth Amidst Recent Slowdowns
Since mid-September, there has been a marked slowdown in Ordinal inscriptions, leading to a decrease in daily confirmed BTC transactions. Inscriptions plummeted on September 24, 2023, and haven‚Äôt rebounded since. As of block height 813,333, there are about 35,377,327 inscriptions tied to the Bitcoin blockchain.
While more than 232,000 inscriptions were added on September 24, the‚Ä¶

entry.title: By The Numbers: Here‚Äôs How MicroStrategy‚Äôs Bitcoin Strategy Is Going
entry.summary:
MicroStrategy‚Äôs Bitcoin holdings are now in profit again. MicroStrategy is well known to be one of the largest Bitcoin buyers in recent years. The company is such a believer in Bitcoin that it sold some of its stocks to increase its Bitcoin holdings. This would seem extreme to some investors, but as suggested by recent price action, MicroStrategy‚Äôs Bitcoin strategy seems to be paying off.¬†
How MicroStrategy‚Äôs Bitcoin Strategy Is Going
MicroStrategy started investing in Bitcoin in 2020, becoming one of the first companies to do so. The firm started by buying $250 million worth of Bitcoin in August 2020 and hasn‚Äôt slowed down since. In its latest move, MicroStrategy acquired approximately 5,445 Bitcoins for approximately $147.3 million between August 1, 2023, and September 24, 2023. Ac‚Ä¶

entry.title: Centralized Mining Pools ‚ÄòAntithetical to the Ideals That Gave Rise to BTC and the Blockchain Movement‚Äô ‚Äî Tomer Afek
entry.summary:
The apparent centralization in both proof-of-work and proof-of-stake protocols is ‚Äútragic because it‚Äôs antithetical to the cypherpunk ideals‚Äù that birthed the the bitcoin and blockchain movement, Tomer Afek, the CEO at the crypto platform Spacemesh, has argued. To back this assertion, Afek told Bitcoin.com News that only two Bitcoin mining pools control more than 50% of the network‚Äôs hashrate while the top five pools control more than 75%.
‚ÄòCentralization and Consolidation of Mining Resources‚Äô
For Afek, the concentration of the Bitcoin network‚Äôs mining power among a few players should worry decentralization proponents because it means such ‚Äúcentralized actors‚Äù are accountable to no one. According to the Spacemesh CEO, the situation is even worse with protocols that use the proof-of-sta‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bitcoin Developer Sounds The Alarm: There‚Äôs A Backdoor In The Lightning Network
entry.summary:
Bitcoin‚Äôs Lightning Network was designed to make Bitcoin transactions faster and cheaper. But according to a recent discovery by a now former Lightning developer Antoine Riard, there‚Äôs a major security flaw in the network that puts users‚Äô funds at risk. Taking to a thread on the Linux Foundation‚Äôs public mailing list, Riard detailed the new discovery of a security risk in the Lightning Network that could allow hackers to easily get control of the Layer 2 protocol.
Developer Departs From Bitcoin Lightning Network Over Security Concerns
The Bitcoin Lightning Network is a ‚Äúlayer 2‚Äù payment protocol that operates on top of the Bitcoin blockchain. It enables fast, low-cost transactions between participating nodes. Since its inception, the Bitcoin Layer 2 protocol has been well accepted, a‚Ä¶

entry.title: Report: Africa-Focused Crypto Trading App Shut Down ‚Äî Co-Founder Says Only Nigerian Users Affected
entry.summary:
The Africa-focused crypto trading app Vibra has reportedly stopped working in Ghana, Kenya, and Nigeria. Reports that the app is not working in the three countries contradict the co-founder‚Äôs claim that only users from Nigeria are affected.
Resign or Get Fired
An Africa-focused crypto trading app, Vibra, has reportedly been stopped in Ghana, Kenya and Nigeria. Vincent Li, the co-founder of African Blockchain Labs ‚Äî the organization behind the app ‚Äî insisted however that the measure only affected users in Nigeria. He also added that the suspension would be temporary.
Nevertheless, an Oct. 18 Techcabal report quotes current and former employees who have confirmed the app‚Äôs stoppage in all African markets. The employees, who did not wish to be identified, also told the publication that‚Ä¶

entry.title: Ex-General Counsel Sheds Light on FTX‚Äôs $7B Gap in Bankman-Fried Fraud Trial
entry.summary:
FTX‚Äôs former general counsel Can Sun testified Thursday in federal court that he was shocked to learn FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried (SBF) had secretly transferred billions in customer funds to his hedge fund Alameda Research. Sun told prosecutors he resigned the day after realizing the scope of customer money siphoned, following spreadsheets showing $7 billion was missing.
‚ÄòFunds Had Been Misappropriated,‚Äô Former FTX Lawyer Says
Can Sun, former general counsel of the failed crypto exchange FTX, took the stand Thursday in Sam Bankman-Fried‚Äòs criminal fraud trial. Sun told federal prosecutors he was unaware FTX had secretly transferred customer funds to Bankman-Fried‚Äôs trading firm Alameda Research.
‚ÄúI was shocked. There were $7 billion missing,‚Äù testified Sun about learning the exten‚Ä¶

entry.title: Morgan Stanley: Crypto Winter May Be Over, Crypto Spring ‚ÄòLikely on the Horizon‚Äô
entry.summary:
Global investment bank Morgan Stanley believes that ‚Äúcrypto winter may be in the past and that crypto spring is likely on the horizon.‚Äù An analyst at the bank explained that historically, most of bitcoin‚Äôs gains come directly after a halving event that occurs every four years.
Morgan Stanley Foresees Crypto Spring
Global investment bank Morgan Stanley‚Äôs wealth management division published a report titled ‚ÄúWill Crypto Spring Ever Come?‚Äù this week. Morgan Stanley analyst Denny Galindo outlined that there are four phases of cryptocurrency prices. ‚ÄúThe four-year cryptocurrency cycle roughly corresponds to the four seasons of the year,‚Äù he noted.
‚ÄúJust as a farmer avoids planting seedlings in the winter or too late in the spring, crypto investors want to know when crypto spring has arriv‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bitcoin.com Partners With Hummingbot in VERSE/USDT Campaign on KuCoin With $15,000 in Rewards
entry.summary:
PRESS RELEASE. October 22nd, 2023 ‚Äî Bitcoin.com, a global leader in introducing newcomers to cryptocurrency, is thrilled to announce the launch of an innovative campaign aimed at enhancing liquidity and trading volumes for the VERSE/USDT trading pair on KuCoin. This strategic campaign will be executed in partnership with Hummingbot, the foremost open-source market making bot.
Structured around Hummingbot‚Äôs Liquidity Miner platform, the campaign focuses on incentivizing market makers and the Hummingbot community for their market-making services on centralized exchanges, facilitating a more decentralized market-making process. Hummingbot is used by trading firms, individual traders who run bots to earn liquidity mining rewards, and cryptocurrency projects who want to own their liquidity. ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Robert Kiyosaki Says Bitcoin Headed for $135,000 While Gold Will Soon Take Off
entry.summary:
Rich Dad Poor Dad author Robert Kiyosaki expects the price of bitcoin to reach $135,000. He also foresees substantial growth in the price of gold, reaching $3,700 in the near future. In contrast, the renowned author has warned that savers of U.S. dollars, which he calls ‚Äúfake money,‚Äù will be in trouble.
Robert Kiyosaki‚Äôs Price Predictions for Bitcoin, Gold, Silver
The author of Rich Dad Poor Dad, Robert Kiyosaki, shared his expectations on the future prices of gold, silver, and bitcoin in a post on social media platform X on Friday. Rich Dad Poor Dad is a 1997 book co-authored by Kiyosaki and Sharon Lechter. It has been on the New York Times Best Seller List for over six years. More than 32 million copies of the book have been sold in over 51 languages across more than 109 countries. ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Major Exploit Sees $6 Million In XRP Lost
entry.summary:
Philippines-based crypto exchange Coins.ph is rumored to be the latest victim of an exploit that has potentially led to the loss of 12.2 million XRP ($6 million) for the firm. However, a part of these funds seem to have already been recovered.¬†
Evidence Of The Alleged Exploit
According to a report by The Block, the hack on the crypto exchange occurred on October 17, with the media outlet citing a source familiar with the matter. Coins is yet to release an official statement as to whether or not the incident truly occurred.
However, on-chain data suggests that this exploit might have indeed occurred, as The Block noted. According to data on the blockchain explorer XRP scan, the crypto exchange experienced 13 outflows, with 999,999.999 XRP sent out from the exchange in each transacti‚Ä¶

entry.title: Data Protection Bodies Call For ‚ÄòPrivacy Threshold‚Äô in Digital Euro Transactions
entry.summary:
Ensuring low-value digital euro transactions are not traced is one of the recommendations made by two data protection agencies in the EU. The independent bodies have presented their joint opinion on the proposed regulation for the upcoming digital version of Europe‚Äôs common fiat currency.
Independent EU Regulators Insist on Embedding Data Protection in the Design of the Digital Euro
The European Data Protection Board (EDPB) and the European Data Protection Supervisor (EDPS) have made several recommendations on how to ensure high-level protection for the personal data and privacy of users of the future digital euro.
The stated aim of the eurozone‚Äôs central bank digital currency (CBDC) is to provide Europeans with an alternative means to make online and offline payments, complementing ‚Ä¶

‚ÄúI‚Äôm quite hopeful that these [ETF] applications will be granted, if only because they should be granted under the law,‚Äù Paul stated.

entry.title: US Chamber of Digital Commerce Backs Binance, Urges SEC to Drop Lawsuit
entry.summary:
In a significant move on Thursday, the U.S. Chamber of Digital Commerce, a leading crypto policymaking advocacy group, filed an amicus brief urging the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to dismiss its lawsuit against cryptocurrency giant Binance.
SEC‚Äôs Authority Questioned: Chamber of Digital Commerce Supports Binance
Founded in July 2014 by Perianne Boring, the U.S. Chamber of Digital Commerce is a Washington, D.C.-based trade association and advocacy group that promotes crypto assets and blockchain technology. On October 19, the group filed an amicus brief backing the world‚Äôs largest crypto exchange by trade volume, Binance.
In the brief, the Chamber stressed the importance of maintaining clear jurisdictional boundaries, cautioning against an overreach of the SEC‚Äôs auth‚Ä¶

entry.title: Polygon Paves Way for Governance 2.0 with Introduction of Protocol Council
entry.summary: Polygon takes another step towards decentralized governance, unveiling a new proposal to form a new 13-person protocol council.

entry.title: Phantom Galaxies: A Look Inside the Mech Shooter NFT Game
entry.summary: Animoca Brands and game studio Blowfish are developing Phantom Galaxies, an upcoming sci-fi mech shooter game inspired by mech battlers like Transformers. Decrypt's Kate Irwin asks Blowfish Studios Cofounder and Managing Director Ben Lee about what it's like to play the game.

entry.title: Clip: DeepMedia's DeepID Deepfake Detection Tool at Work
entry.summary: A clip showcasing how DeepMedia's DeepID deepfake detection tool works. Courtesy: DeepMedia

entry.title: Decentraland AI World Fair Trailer
entry.summary: A trailer for the AI World Fair event in metaverse game Decentraland, taking place from October 25-27. Courtesy: Decentraland.

entry.title: BackTheBunny - Money, Conspiracy, Milady
entry.summary:
Our host Reza Jafery sits down with BackTheBunny to dive deep into money, the fight against crypto that we're witnessing in real-time, and milady culture.
Our Host: https://twitter.com/rezajafery Our Guest: https://twitter.com/BackTheBunny
Our Sponsors https://decrypt.co/1000x

entry.title: 'A Grand Experiment': Shrapnel Studio Head Don Norbury Talks Game Economics
entry.summary: How much of Shrapnel's in-game items are tradeable NFTs? Don Norbury, Studio Head at Shrapnel and CTO at game studio NEON, tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about Shrapnel's approach to game economics, including different game pricing models and how NFT game economies create different challenges for developers.

entry.title: Trezor Safe 3 and Trezor Keep Metal Unboxing
entry.summary: Trezor has launched the Safe 3, a hardware wallet aimed at "new entrants to crypto," alongside the new Keep Metal recovery seed storage device. We take a first look at what comes in the box.

entry.title: Why AI Arena is Building on Arbitrum
entry.summary: AI Arena CEO Brandon Da Silva and COO Wei Xie discuss the challenges that come with building on Ethereum, ETH sidechains, and layer-two blockchains.

entry.title: Pet3rPan_ on venture DAOs and blockchain games
entry.summary:
Welcome to the 4th episode of this time will be different.
Our guest for today's episode is Pet3rpan_ from Metacartel, 1kx, HydraVentures, and more!
https://twitter.com/pet3rpan_
This Time Will Be Different is sponsored by 1000x https://decrypt.co/1000x

entry.title: Inside Shrapnel's Marketplace, New Map, and 'AI Director' Feature
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin chats with Shrapnel's Head of Studio Don Norbury to get the latest updates on how the NFT-powered first-person sci-fi extraction shooter's development is progressing.

entry.title: 'Art of the Times': Art Blocks Founder Erick Calderon on the State of Generative Art
entry.summary: Art Blocks founder and CEO Erick Calderon sat down with Sander Lutz, lead culture reporter at Decrypt's SCENE, at Art Blocks Marfa Weekend 2023. They discuss the evolution of the company and the generative art world, along with what draws art enthusiasts to be an active part of the community.

entry.title: Decrypt Learn: Digital Ownership Explained
entry.summary: One of the most powerful aspects of blockchain technology is its ability to provide us genuine ownership of our digital assets. This is called digital ownership. In this video, we‚Äôll deep dive into digital ownership, why it matters, and how web3 makes owning digital assets like our social networks, music libraries, personal data, and beyond possible. Author: Clarissa Watson, Senior Writer at Consensys.

entry.title: Martin Shkreli on E/ACC and SBF in Prison
entry.summary: Reza Jafery and Martin Shkreli sit down for a casual conversation about the growing movement that is E/ACC, what songs they could recite at gunpoint, and whether or not SBF will thrive or just survive during his time in prison.

entry.title: What Can AI Do in Gaming?
entry.summary: AI Arena CEO Brandon Da Silva and COO Wei Xie discuss how artificial intelligence can shape the video game experience.

entry.title: 'There Are No Real Standards': Ready Player Me CEO Timmu T√µke on Building for an Open Gaming Ecosystem
entry.summary: Timmu T√µke, co-founder and CEO of Ready Player Me, joins Decrypt contributor Ryan Gladwin to discuss the startup's approach to powering avatars that are interoperable across games and metaverse platforms‚Äîand what's needed to convince the industry to adopt standards and open up.

entry.title: Blockchain Is 'Only Way' Forward for Gaming, Says Shrapnel Studio Head
entry.summary: Shrapnel Studio Head Don Norbury tells Kate Irwin the reasons why the upcoming first-person shooter game will offer a wide range of NFTs. He also reveals team-based gameplay plans and shares how game maps have already changed this year.

entry.title: Social Media Sentiment Is Key to Crypto Price Discovery
entry.summary: Sacha Ghebali, Director of Strategy and Business Development at The TIE, says social media sentiment remains a key factor in price movements for major cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and Ethereum. However, he notes that sentiment has turned more negative lately amid regulatory uncertainty. Ghebali believes events like the Ripple lawsuit ruling significantly impacted sentiment and prices. Andr√© Beganski interviewed him at Messari Mainnet.

entry.title: 500Altcoins discusses DeFi Summer and the Dubai Crypto Scene - This Time Will Be Different - Episode 2
entry.summary: Our host Reza Jafery is joined by Gareth Fenney aka 500Altcoins. They discuss the glory days of DeFi Summer and whether or not its a smart move for builders in the crypto space to relocate to Dubai.
